editorialNotes.standard: Swing, batta batta! Cheeky heckling and memorable stars make this remastered classic as fun as we remember.

Sure, there are skateboarding games that let you pull 900s from telephone wires, then land in a manual, collecting millions of points. But when you want realism and complexity, you want True Skate. For years, True Axisâ€™ skateboarding simulator has been letting us ollie, grind, and kickflip with our fingers. Competing with your friends, scouting gaps, and completing missions is great fun, but the true reward is perfecting a line and nailing incredible tricks with just the right swipes.
editorialNotes.tagline: Ollie and flip for high scores

editorialNotes.short: We're obsessed with nailing the perfect run while admiring the gorgeous scenery.
editorialNotes.standard: In this gorgeous twist on the infinite runner, you guide an agile snowboarder down a never-ending mountain, pulling off backflips over icy chasms and grinding along rooftops in sleepy villages. Simple one-finger controls make it instantly accessible, but tackling each levelâ€™s trio of challenges requires deft reflexes. With its exquisitely rendered visuals, soothing music, and finely tuned gameplay, Altoâ€™s Adventure is simultaneously serene and exciting.

ios.subtitle: Train up and compete in races!
The ducks are ready to fight!

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.short: Bend the rules and knock out opponents in this fun retro-style game.

editorialNotes.standard: Orange ball with a mustache, corner pocket! Nail wild trick shots in this clever mashup of billiards and golf.

editorialNotes.short: The joy of sinking a perfect shot without sunburns or squawking seagulls.
editorialNotes.standard: OK Golf is as stress-free as a golf game gets. We love the cool, crisp lines of the striking polygonal courses, and the one-touch controls are easy to get a grip on. When we do slice one out of bounds, we just pretend we were aiming for one of the many off-course secret bonus holes.

Donâ€™t be fooled by the old-school arcade visualsâ€”instead of testing your reflexes in the ring, Punch Club is a tycoon-style game about the sweet science of turning a down-and-out boxer into the next great champion. Keep your fighter fit, fed, rested, and happy as you meet zany characters, balance work and relationships, laugh at â€™80s movie in-jokes, and acquire a dizzying array of fighting skills. Only the strongestâ€”and the most strategicâ€”will make it to the top.
